byline.contributor: Austin Frakt is a health economist with several governmental and academic affiliations. He blogs at The Incidental Economist, and you can follow him on Twitter at @afrakt.

abstract: The Upshot; studies focused on impact of health insurance plans in Massachusetts and California that have narrower networks reveal that such plans can pass on considerable savings to consumers; narrow network plans are increasingly being offered by insurers on Affordable Care Act marketplaces.

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject

lead_paragraph: Consumers should welcome the lower premiums offered, but a recent study showed a disregard for customers.
snippet: Consumers should welcome the lower premiums offered, but a recent study showed a disregard for customers....

headline.main: Savings? Yes. But Narrow Health Networks Also Show Troubling Signs.
headline.print_headline: Narrow Health Networks: Savings vs. Satisfaction?
